dfischer.utils

Class HttpRequestHeader

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.HttpRequestHeader

  • public class HttpRequestHeader
extends java.lang.Object
    Encloses all data of a HTTP request header.
    See Also:
    HttpTestURL

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HttpRequestHeader()
      Empty constructor for object transfer
      HttpRequestHeader(java.lang.String targetHost, int targetPort, boolean useSSL, java.lang.String headerString, CookieHandler cookieHandler)
      Internal.

      Replaces the request path (inclusive all CGI parameters).
      byte[] toByteArray()
      Converts the whole request header to a byte array - including all required <CR><NL> between the header lines and appends after the last header line an additional, second <CR><NL> (header terminator).

      Returns if the SSL/TLS (HTTPS) protocol is used.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpRequestHeader

        public HttpRequestHeader()
        Empty constructor for object transfer

      • HttpRequestHeader

        public HttpRequestHeader(java.lang.String targetHost,
                 int targetPort,
                 boolean useSSL,
                 java.lang.String headerString,
                 CookieHandler cookieHandler)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Internal. Parses an http/s request and automatically applies cookies from the cookie handler
        Parameters:
        targetHost - hostname or ip addess of web server
        targetPort - tcp/ip port number of web server
        useSSL - true if HTTPS is used
        headerString - request header itself
        cookieHandler - reference to cookie handler
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • applyHttpProxy

        public void applyHttpProxy(NextProxyConfig nextProxyConfig)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Applies proxy settings for indirect network connections over a HTTP proxy server. Converts the URL of the request header from a relative URL to an absolute URL and adds the Proxy-Authorization header field if needed. This method must not be called for HTTPS proxy connections.
        Parameters:
        nextProxyConfig - HTTP proxy configuration data, only applied if marked as active
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • hasHeaderField

        public boolean hasHeaderField(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Check if the request header already contains a specific header field.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - field name
        Returns:
        true if the request header already contains the specific header field, else false

      • getHeaderField

        public java.lang.String getHeaderField(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Get the value of a request header field.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - field name
        Returns:
        the value of a request header field, or null if no header field with the passed name was found.

      • appendHeaderField

        public void appendHeaderField(java.lang.String fieldName,
                     java.lang.String fieldValue)
        Adds a field to the request header.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - field name
        fieldValue - field value

      • setHeaderField

        public void setHeaderField(java.lang.String fieldName,
                  java.lang.String fieldValue)
        Replaces the value of an existing field in the request header, or add a new field to the request header if the field name is not found.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - field name
        fieldValue - field value

      • getTargetHost

        public java.lang.String getTargetHost()
        Returns the hostname of the (target) web server.
        Returns:
        the hostname of the (target) web server.

      • getTargetPort

        public int getTargetPort()
        Returns the TCP/IP port number of the (target) web server.
        Returns:
        the TCP/IP port number of the (target) web server.

      • getTargetPath

        public java.lang.String getTargetPath()
        Returns the request path inclusive all CGI parameters. This is extracted from the first HTTP header line.
        Returns:
        the request path inclusive all CGI parameters, or null if no request path was found.

      • setTargetPath

        public void setTargetPath(java.lang.String urlPath)
        Replaces the request path (inclusive all CGI parameters). Note: cookies are not readjust by this method.
        Parameters:
        urlPath - the new request path

      • useSSL

        public boolean useSSL()
        Returns if the SSL/TLS (HTTPS) protocol is used.
        Returns:
        true, if the SSL/TLS (HTTPS) protocol is used.

      • getHttpRequestMethod

        public java.lang.String getHttpRequestMethod()
        Returns the HTTP request method in UPPERCASE (GET, POST, HEAD ...).
        Returns:
        the HTTP request method in UPPERCASE

      • getParsedUrl

        public ParseUrl getParsedUrl()
        Returns the parsed URL of the first request line.
        Returns:
        the parsed URL of the first request line

      • isHttp11

        public boolean isHttp11()
        Returns if the HTTP protocol version 1.1 is used.
        Returns:
        true, if the HTTP protocol version 1.1 is used

      • isHttpProxyRequest

        public boolean isHttpProxyRequest()
        Returns if the request is executed over a HTTP proxy. Note: the result is only valid for unencrypted HTTP requests because HTTPS proxys for encrypted requests are working in a different way.
        Returns:
        true, if the request is executed over a HTTP proxy

      • toByteArray

        public byte[] toByteArray()
        Converts the whole request header to a byte array - including all required <CR><NL> between the header lines and appends after the last header line an additional, second <CR><NL> (header terminator).
        Returns:
        the request header as a byte array.

      • getHeaderVector

        public java.util.Vector getHeaderVector()
        Returns the whole request header as a vector of strings.
        Returns:
        the request header as a vector of strings, or an empty vector if no request header is available

      • logHeader

        public void logHeader(java.lang.Object logVectorObject)
        Logs the request header to a log vector
        Parameters:
        logVectorObject - Objects which has implemented the LogVectorInterface
        See Also:
        LogVectorInterface

      • getUrlRequestInfoText

        public java.lang.String getUrlRequestInfoText(boolean includeRequestMethod)
        Return a small text information about the request.
        Example: "GET http://192.16.4.5:80/screenshots_en.html"
        Parameters:
        includeRequestMethod - if set to true the result contains also the HTTP request method (GET, POST, HEAD ..)
        Returns:
        a small text information about the request (inclusive the HTTP request method, the URL information and all CGI parameters), or null if no such information is available.
